CatDescriptText: Mr. Otis Lyons, 3147 Spring Way, Lawrenceville and Miss Mary Matthews, 173 Brighton Pl., North Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 26, 1957, pg. 1, with question: "Do you believe we should have a state law forbidding strikes of trolley cars, buses, and taxicabs?" Mr. Otis Lyons answer reads: "In that there has been so many conflicts between labor and capital, there should be a municipal authority created by state law for stopping strikes and serving as a medium between capital and labor." Miss Mary Matthews answer reads: "I think there should be a state law.  People have to get back and forth to work and when a strike like this trolley strike comes along everything is crippled."
TitMainTitle: Otis Lyons wearing fedora and Mary Matthews wearing dark jacket with studded sleeves, standing on sidewalk with cars and businesses in background including "A. Topp Wholesale Eggs"
